author: Special Correspondent
text:
Chennai District Election Office is set to organise a range of events as part of National Voters’ Day on Monday.

All first-time voters are likely to get their Electors Photo Identity Cards (EPIC) at 889 locations across the district on Monday.

More than one lakh first-time voters in Chennai district are expected to exercise their franchise during the Assembly elections in a few months.

As many as 56,135 male voters, 45,338 female voters and 25 others in the age group of 18-19 have been included on the electoral rolls in the 16 Assembly constituencies in the district.

Officials of the District Election Office will distribute EPIC to such voters. Distribution of EPIC to more than 13,000 flood-affected voters in areas such as Saidapet and T. Nagar has already started.

“Zonal officers have started organising events to congratulate and welcome those who have just been enrolled as voters. Each zone has made arrangements to persuade voters for greater participation in elections,” said an official of Chennai Corporation.

Such events would also reflect the theme of the National Voters’ Day this year: ‘Inclusive and Qualitative Participation.’
title: Over a lakh youth set to cast maiden vote
